result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore D Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable immediately; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge immediately; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.
*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore D Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore D Smith in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Theodore D Smith in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.   The Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, consecutive with to any other sentence.    

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable immediately; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge immediately; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Invoice forwarded to Account Payable in the amount of $406.25 to Dr Deborah Collins for services on 11-23-2015,12.03-2015.Copy on file.
Plea/Sentencing Hearing on Friday, February 12, 2016 at 8:30 AM in 19, SB Rm 313 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
ORDER TO PRODUCE    RECEIVED AND FILED

Court proceeded with the plea.  After statements from State and defense   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theodore D Smith in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Theodore D Smith in custody.  Francesco Mineo and Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Letter 12/3/215 from Dr. Collins does not support an NGI.  Attorney Bihler withdraws request for a competency evaluation.  Attorney Bihler informs the court that the defendant wishes to proceed to a plea hearing.
from Dr. Collins dated 12/3/2015, received and filed

Defendant Theodore D Smith in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Theodore D Smith in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Collins be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI and competency pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16 and 971.14(2).   Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 10.
Filed, signed Order for Examination.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Br. 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Theodore D Smith not in court, in custody in Racine County.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theodore D Smith in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Theodore D Smith in custody.  Pat Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl Branch 19.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce for Preliminary Hearing on August 28, 2015 @ 1:30pm received and filed

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Theodore D Smith in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Theodore D Smith in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
